title: C04-1103

sentences.text: Machine transliteration/back-transliteration plays an important role in many multilingual speech and language applications .

In this paper , a novel framework for machine transliteration/backtransliteration that allows us to carry out direct orthographical mapping -LRB- DOM -RRB- between two different languages is presented .
Under this framework , a joint source-channel transliteration model , also called n-gram transliteration model -LRB- n-gram TM -RRB- , is further proposed to model the transliteration process .
We evaluate the proposed methods through several transliteration/backtransliteration experiments for English/Chinese and English/Japanese language pairs .
Our study reveals that the proposed method not only reduces an extensive system development effort but also improves the transliteration accuracy significantly .

Entity-n-gram_transliteration_model_-lrb.description: A joint source-channel transliteration model proposed under a novel framework for machine transliteration/backtransliteration, also referred to as an n-gram transliteration model.

Entity-under_this_framework.label: Under this framework
Entity-under_this_framework.description: A novel approach for machine transliteration/backtransliteration, which involves direct orthographical mapping between two different languages and uses a joint source-channel transliteration model.

Entity-the_proposed_method.label: the proposed methods
Entity-the_proposed_method.description: The novel joint source-channel transliteration models, including n-gram TM, proposed to model the machine transliteration/backtransliteration process.

Entity-joint_source-channel_transliterat.label: joint source-channel transliteration model
aliases: joint source-channel transliteration model, also called n-gram transliteration model -LRB- n-gram TM -RRB-
Entity-joint_source-channel_transliterat.description: A novel statistical framework for machine transliteration and back-transliteration, which models both the source language and channel (orthographical mapping) aspects of the transliteration process.

mentions.local_name: joint source-channel transliteration model, also called n-gram transliteration model -LRB- n-gram TM -RRB-

Entity-a_joint_source-channel_transliter.label: a joint source-channel transliteration model
Entity-a_joint_source-channel_transliter.description: A statistical framework for modeling the transliteration process between two languages, combining both linguistic and orthographical information.

Entity-dom.label: DOM
Entity-dom.description: A framework or system for performing direct orthographical mappings between two different languages.

Entity-machine_transliterationback-trans.label: Machine transliteration/back-transliteration
Entity-machine_transliterationback-trans.description: A technique or method for converting text from one writing system to another, often involving both transliteration (converting characters) and back-transliteration (reversing the conversion).

Entity-englishchinese_and_englishjapanes.description: A pair of languages, consisting of one language (English) paired with another language (either Chinese or Japanese), used in machine transliteration/back-transliteration experiments.

Entity-our_study.description: The evaluation of a novel framework for machine transliteration/backtransliteration, including its impact on reducing system development efforts and improving transliteration accuracy.

Entity-transliterationbacktransliteratio.label: transliteration/backtransliteration experiments
Entity-transliterationbacktransliteratio.description: A process of converting written texts from one script to another, with the ability to reverse this conversion.

Entity-novel_framework.label: novel framework
Entity-novel_framework.description: A novel approach or methodology for processing, analyzing, or generating text that enables direct mapping or transformation between different languages.

Entity-transliteration_accuracy.label: transliteration accuracy
Entity-transliteration_accuracy.description: A measure of how accurately written text in one script or language has been converted into another.

Entity-englishjapanese_language_pair.label: English/Japanese language pair
Entity-englishjapanese_language_pair.description: A pair of languages, typically used together in translation or communication tasks.

Entity-transliteration_process.label: transliteration process
Entity-transliteration_process.description: The act of converting written text from one script or writing system into another using a standardized set of rules.

Entity-multilingual_speech_and_language_.label: multilingual speech and language applications

Entity-multilingual_speech_and_language_.description: A field that deals with the development, application, and study of systems for processing, generating, and understanding languages spoken by multiple linguistic groups.

Entity-englishchinese.description: A pairing of two languages, specifically English and Chinese.

summary: Machine transliteration/back-transliteration plays an important role in many multilingual speech and language applications . In this paper , a novel framework for machine transliteration/backtransliteration that allows us to carry out direct orthographical mapping -LRB- DOM -RRB- between two different languages is presented . Under this framework , a joint source-channel transliteration model , also called n-gram transliteration model -LRB- n-gram TM -RRB- , is further proposed to model the transliteration process . We evaluate the proposed methods through several transliteration/backtransliteration experiments for English/Chinese and English/Japanese language pairs . Our study reveals that the proposed method not only reduces an extensive system development effort but also improves the transliteration accuracy significantly .

Predicate-plays_an_important_role_in.label: plays an important role in
Predicate-plays_an_important_role_in.description: Indicates that the subject has a significant influence or contribution to the object's existence, functionality, or significance. The predicate highlights the subject's relevance and importance in relation to the object.

Predicate-allows.label: allows
Predicate-allows.description: The predicate 'allows' indicates a relationship where the subject enables or permits the object to occur, exist, or be used. In this context, it suggests that the machine transliteration/back-transliteration process facilitates direct orthographical mapping between two different languages.

Predicate-allows_us_to_carry_out.label: allows us to carry out
Predicate-allows_us_to_carry_out.description: The predicate 'allows us to carry out' indicates that the subject provides a means or enables an action, which results in the object being performed. In general, it suggests a facilitative relationship between the subject and the object, where the subject's presence or existence makes possible the occurrence of the object.

Predicate-proposes.label: proposes
Predicate-proposes.description: To propose means to suggest or recommend something as a potential solution, plan, or idea. The predicate 'proposes' indicates that the subject (in this case, an entity such as a framework) presents or advocates for the object (a concept, model, or approach), often with the intention of implementing it or exploring its feasibility.

Predicate-evaluate.label: evaluate
Predicate-evaluate.description: To evaluate means to assess or judge the quality, effectiveness, or value of something based on certain criteria or standards. The subject performs this assessment and forms an opinion about the object, which can be a method, idea, proposal, performance, etc.

Predicate-through.label: through
Predicate-through.description: The predicate 'through' indicates a means or method by which something (the subject) achieves its purpose or outcome. It connects the subject to the object, suggesting that the methods or processes described in the object are used to accomplish or facilitate the experiments mentioned in the subject.

Predicate-are_evaluated_through.label: are evaluated through
Predicate-are_evaluated_through.description: The predicate 'are evaluated through' indicates a means or method by which something (the subject) is assessed, judged, or determined. It implies that the object provides the framework, criteria, or process for evaluating the subject.

Predicate-reveals_that.label: reveals that
Predicate-reveals_that.description: The predicate 'reveals that' indicates a relationship where the subject (a person or entity conducting an investigation or inquiry) uncovers and presents new information about something, which is explicitly stated in the object. The connection between the subject and object is one of discovery and exposition.

Predicate-reduces.label: reduces
Predicate-reduces.description: The predicate 'reduces' indicates a relationship where the subject contributes to or brings about a decrease or simplification of something described by the object. This can imply a reduction in complexity, size, scope, effort, or other quantifiable aspects.

Predicate-proposed_under.label: proposed under
Predicate-proposed_under.description: The predicate 'proposed under' indicates a relationship where one concept or method (subject) was developed, tested, or validated within the framework of another concept or approach (object). This connection suggests that the subject's validity, applicability, or effectiveness is grounded in or dependent on the object. In general, this predicate implies a hierarchical or subordinate relationship between the two entities.

skos:broader.label: has a broader term
skos:broader.description: The predicate 'has a broader term' indicates that the subject concept is a specific instance or subclass of a more general category or class represented by the object. It establishes a hierarchical relationship between the two, where the subject is a narrower or more specialized version of the object.
